meanings.definition: In a way that cannot be moved or changed.
meanings.sent1: The heavy boulder sat immovably on the ground.
meanings.sent2: The old tree stood immovably in the middle of the field.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn donkey planted its feet immovably, refusing to budge.
meanings.sent4: Her beliefs were immovably anchored in tradition.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins remained immovably silent, holding secrets of the past.

meanings.definition: In a fixed or unchangeable manner.
meanings.sent1: The rules of the game were immovably set by the referee.
meanings.sent2: The painting was hung immovably on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The cat gazed immovably at the bird outside the window.
meanings.sent4: His decision was immovably firm, unwavering in the face of doubt.
meanings.sent5: The mountain range loomed immovably in the distance, a timeless presence.
